article:
A 'multicenter research trial' is a clinical trial conducted at more than one
medical center or clinic. Most large clinical trials, particularly Phase III
trials, are conducted at several clinical research centers. The benefits of
multicenter trials include a larger number of participants, different geographic
locations, the possibility of inclusion of a wider range of population groups,
and the ability to compare results among centers, all of which increase the
generalizability of the study. In many cases, efficacy will vary significantly
between population groups with different genetic, environmental, and ethnic or
cultural backgrounds ("demographic" factors); normally only geographically
dispersed trials can properly evaluate this.
